Name: emby
Overview: Emby(https://emby.media/) organizes video, music, live TV, and photos from personal media libraries and streams them to smart TVs, streaming boxes and mobile devices. This container is packaged as a standalone emby Media Server.

Port: 8920.Name: Port: 8920
Port: 8920.Description: Https webUI (you need to setup your own certificate).

Appdata.Name: Appdata
Appdata.Description: Emby data storage location. *This can grow very large, 50gb+ is likely for a large collection.*

Path: /data/tvshows.Name: Path: /data/tvshows
Path: /data/tvshows.Description: Media goes here. Add as many as needed e.g. `/data/movies`, `/data/tv`, etc.

Path: /data/movies.Name: Path: /data/movies
Path: /data/movies.Description: Media goes here. Add as many as needed e.g. `/data/movies`, `/data/tv`, etc.

Path: /opt/vc/lib.Name: Path: /opt/vc/lib
Path: /opt/vc/lib.Description: Path for Raspberry Pi OpenMAX libs *optional*.

/dev/dri.Name: /dev/dri
/dev/dri.Description: Only needed if you want to use your Intel or AMD GPU for hardware accelerated video encoding (vaapi).

/dev/vchiq.Name: /dev/vchiq
/dev/vchiq.Description: Only needed if you want to use your Raspberry Pi OpenMax video encoding (Bellagio).

/dev/video10.Name: /dev/video10
/dev/video10.Description: Only needed if you want to use your Raspberry Pi V4L2 video encoding.

/dev/video11.Name: /dev/video11
/dev/video11.Description: Only needed if you want to use your Raspberry Pi V4L2 video encoding.

/dev/video12.Name: /dev/video12
/dev/video12.Description: Only needed if you want to use your Raspberry Pi V4L2 video encoding.
